name: Mount Galehead

trails_config.name: Gale River & Garfield Ridge
trails_config.description: A largely gradual hike via Gale River Trail (which has been rerouted to avoid river crossings) leads to Galehead Hut, a perfect rest stop nestled below Galehead. A short but steep spur from the hut ascends to Galehead’s wooded summit. While the summit itself has no views, just before it an outlook called The Twin Brook Outlook offers a beautiful vista of the Twins and Bonds. Many hikers enjoy relaxing at the hut and admiring the nearby South Twin and Garfield slopes after tagging Galehead’s summit.
trails_config.parking_info: Gale River Trailhead, Gale River Loop Rd

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 4024 feet, Mount Galehead offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4024 feet, Mount Galehead is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Gale River & Garfield Ridge**, a **10.2 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **North Twin Mountain**, which is just 1.1 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
